page.title: 02LANDSCAPE(HERTFORDSHIRE)
page.content: The land in the East of our area is mainly cereal crops,however,on the West is more pasture.There are many farms as it is agricultural.There are a few patches of woodland,mainly deciduous trees.The only villages are part of Flamstead,the outskirts of Markyate and a small residential area called Jockey End.The relief of the land is gently rolling hills.The A5(main road) runs from London to Holyhead and passes through our area, otherwise there are just tracks and narrow lanes.The only river is the Ver which flows alongside the A5.The animals are a mixture of sheep,pigs and cows.The soil profile is mainly chalk underneath and either Batcombe, Winchester or gravel on top.
